post.summary: Authenticate with a <body>user-id</body> and <body>password</body> and get a JWT token. The token should be included in request headers under "Authorization: Bearer ..." in order to prove successful authentication to the server.

get.summary: List all users

post.summary: Create a new user

get.summary: Get a user by ID

delete.summary: Delete a user

patch.summary: Modify a user. Admins may change the username, password, and admin status of any user. All other users may only modify their own username or password.

get.summary: List all projects accessible to user

post.summary: Create a new project. Note: this also registers the user as a maintainer.

get.summary: Get a project by ID. If <body>include-documents</body> is true, also include document IDs and names.

delete.summary: Delete a project.

post.summary: Set a user's access level to read-only for this project.

delete.summary: Remove a user's reader privileges for this project.

post.summary: Set a user's access level to read and write for this project.

delete.summary: Remove a user's writer privileges for this project.

post.summary: Assign a user as a maintainer for this project.

delete.summary: Remove a user's maintainer privileges for this project.

post.summary: Link a vocabulary to a project.

delete.summary: Unlink a vocabulary to a project.

get.summary: Listen to audit log events and messages for a project via Server-Sent Events

post.summary: INTERNAL, do not use directly.
Send a message to all clients that are listening to a project. Useful for e.g. telling an NLP service to perform some work.

put.summary: Set a configuration value for a layer in a editor namespace. Intended for storing metadata about how the layer is intended to be used, e.g. for morpheme tokenization or sentence boundary marking.

delete.summary: Remove a configuration value for a layer.

post.summary: Create a new document in a project. Requires <body>project-id</body> and <body>name</body>.

get.summary: Get a document. Set <query>include-body</query> to true in order to include all data contained in the document.

delete.summary: Delete a document and all data contained.

patch.summary:
Update a document. Supported keys:

<body>name</body>: update a document's name.

put.summary: Replace all metadata for a document. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a document.

post.summary:
Create a new text in a document's text layer. A text is simply a container for one long string in <body>body</body> for a given layer.

<body>text-layer-id</body>: the text's associated layer.
<body>document-id</body>: the text's associated document.
<body>body</body>: the string which is the content of this text.

get.summary: Get a text.

delete.summary: Delete a text and all dependent data.

patch.summary: Update a text's <body>body</body>. A diff is computed between the new and old bodies, and a best effort is made to minimize Levenshtein distance between the two. Token indices are updated so that tokens remain intact. Tokens which fall within a range of deleted text are either shrunk appropriately if there is partial overlap or else deleted if there is whole overlap.

put.summary: Replace all metadata for a text. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a text.

post.summary: Create a new text layer for a project.

get.summary: Get a text layer by ID.

delete.summary: Delete a text layer.

post.summary: Shift a text layer's order within the project.

put.summary: Set a configuration value for a layer in a editor namespace. Intended for storing metadata about how the layer is intended to be used, e.g. for morpheme tokenization or sentence boundary marking.

delete.summary: Remove a configuration value for a layer.

post.summary: Create a new token layer.

get.summary: Get a token layer by ID.

delete.summary: Delete a token layer.

post.summary: Shift a token layer's order.

put.summary: Set a configuration value for a layer in a editor namespace. Intended for storing metadata about how the layer is intended to be used, e.g. for morpheme tokenization or sentence boundary marking.

delete.summary: Remove a configuration value for a layer.

post.summary:
Create a new token in a token layer. Tokens define text substrings using<body>begin</body> and <body>end</body> offsets in the text. Tokens may be zero-width, and they may overlap with each other. For tokens which share the same <body>begin</body>, <body>precedence</body> may be used to indicate a preferred linear ordering, with tokens with lower <body>precedence</body> occurring earlier.

<body>token-layer-id</body>: the layer in which to insert this token.
<body>text</body>: the text in which this token is found.
<body>begin</body>: the inclusive character-based offset at which this token begins in the body of the text specified by <body>text</body>
<body>end</body>: the exclusive character-based offset at which this token ends in the body of the text specified by <body>text</body>
<body>precedence</body>: used for tokens with the same <body>begin</body> value in order to indicate their preferred linear order.

Create multiple tokens in a single operation. Provide an array of objects whose keysare:
<body>token-layer-id</body>, the token's layer
<body>text</body>, the ID of the token's text
<body>begin</body>, the character index at which the token begins (inclusive)
<body>end</body>, the character index at which the token ends (exclusive)
<body>precedence</body>, optional, an integer controlling which orders appear first in linear order when two or more tokens have the same <body>begin</body>
<body>metadata</body>, an optional map of metadata

delete.summary: Delete multiple tokens in a single operation. Provide an array of IDs.

get.summary: Get a token.

delete.summary: Delete a token and remove it from any spans. If this causes the span to have no remaining associated tokens, the span will also be deleted.

patch.summary:
Update a token. Supported keys:

<body>begin</body>: start index of the token
<body>end</body>: end index of the token
<body>precedence</body>: ordering value for the token relative to other tokens with the same <body>begin</body>--lower means earlier

put.summary: Replace all metadata for a token. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a token.

post.summary:
Create a new span. A span holds a primary atomic value and optional metadata, and must at all times be associated with one or more tokens.

<body>span-layer-id</body>: the span's associated layer
<body>tokens</body>: a list of tokens associated with this span. Must contain at least one token. All tokens must belong to a single layer which is linked to the span layer indicated by <body>span-layer-id</body>.
<body>value</body>: the primary value of the span (must be string, number, boolean, or null).
<body>metadata</body>: optional key-value pairs for additional annotation data.

Create multiple spans in a single operation. Provide an array of objects whose keysare:
<body>span-layer-id</body>, the span's layer
<body>tokens</body>, the IDs of the span's constituent tokens
<body>value</body>, the relation's value
<body>metadata</body>, an optional map of metadata

delete.summary: Delete multiple spans in a single operation. Provide an array of IDs.

get.summary: Get a span by ID.

delete.summary: Delete a span.

put.summary: Replace all metadata for a span. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a span.

post.summary: Create a new span layer.

get.summary: Get a span layer by ID.

delete.summary: Delete a span layer.

post.summary: Shift a span layer's order.

put.summary: Set a configuration value for a layer in a editor namespace. Intended for storing metadata about how the layer is intended to be used, e.g. for morpheme tokenization or sentence boundary marking.

delete.summary: Remove a configuration value for a layer.

post.summary:
Create a new relation. A relation is a directed edge between two spans with a value, useful for expressing phenomena such as syntactic or semantic relations. A relation must at all times have both a valid source and target span. These spans must also belong to a single span layer which is linked to the relation's relation layer.

<body>layer-id</body>: the relation layer
<body>source-id</body>: the source span this relation originates from
<body>target-id</body>: the target span this relation goes to
<body>value</value>: the label for the relation

Create multiple relations in a single operation. Provide an array of objects whose keysare:
<body>relation-layer-id</body>, the relation's layer
<body>source</body>, the span id of the relation's source
<body>target</body>, the span id of the relation's target
<body>value</body>, the relation's value
<body>metadata</body>, an optional map of metadata

delete.summary: Delete multiple relations in a single operation. Provide an array of IDs.

get.summary: Get a relation by ID.

delete.summary: Delete a relation.

put.summary: Update the source span of a relation.
Update the target span of a relation.
Replace all metadata for a relation. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a relation.

post.summary: Create a new relation layer.

get.summary: Get a relation layer by ID.

delete.summary: Delete a relation layer.

post.summary: Shift a relation layer's order.

put.summary: Set a configuration value for a layer in a editor namespace. Intended for storing metadata about how the layer is intended to be used, e.g. for morpheme tokenization or sentence boundary marking.

delete.summary: Remove a configuration value for a layer.

get.summary: Get audit log for a project
Get audit log for a document
Get audit log for a user's actions

200.description: Array of responses for each operation

post.summary: Execute multiple API operations in a single request.

get.summary: List all vocab layers accessible to user

post.summary: Create a new vocab layer. Note: this also registers the user as a maintainer.

get.summary: Get a vocab layer by ID

delete.summary: Delete a vocab layer.

post.summary: Assign a user as a maintainer for this vocab layer.

delete.summary: Remove a user's maintainer privileges for this vocab layer.

put.summary: Set a configuration value for a layer in a editor namespace. Intended for storing metadata about how the layer is intended to be used, e.g. for morpheme tokenization or sentence boundary marking.

delete.summary: Remove a configuration value for a layer.

post.summary: Create a new vocab item

get.summary: Get a vocab item by ID

delete.summary: Delete a vocab item

put.summary: Replace all metadata for a vocab item. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a vocab item.

post.summary: Create a new vocab link (link between tokens and vocab item).

get.summary: Get a vocab link by ID

delete.summary: Delete a vocab link

put.summary: Replace all metadata for a vocab link. The entire metadata map is replaced - existing metadata keys not included in the request will be removed.

delete.summary: Remove all metadata from a vocab link.
